required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of the Utility of Strabismus Intelligent Diagnostic System
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of the Utility of Strabismus Intelligent Diagnostic System: A Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Strabismus affects approximately 0.8%-6.8% of the world's population and appears by the age of 3 years in 65% of affected individuals. Manual measurement of deviation is often laborious and highly dependent on the experience of the specialist and the cooperation of the patients. Current strabismus evaluation technologies are heavily dependent on model eyes. Here, the investigators use deep learning to develop an artificial intelligence (AI) platform consisting of three deep learning (DL) systems to screen strabismus, evaluate deviation and propose a surgical plan based on corneal light-reflection photos. The investigator also conduct clinical trial to validate its versatility in clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of accurate, mistaken and miss detection of the diagnostic system.

intervention.description: An AI platform based on corneal light-reflection photos to facilitate the diagnosis and angle evaluation of strabismus and to provide advice for surgical planning.

study_pop.textblock: A prospective study to validate the accuracy of the strabismus intelligent diagnostic system in the clinical practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients in the outpatient clinic of strabismus department.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients or their parents diagree to participate in the trial.
- Patients with blepharoptosis.
- Patients can't facing forward or lacking fixation.

facility.name: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University
